intro: Sebastiania hispida var. aspera, commonly known as the rough-sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, humid environments. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
